TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EnvelopedCms extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a CMS/PKCS#7 structure for enveloped data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Cryptographic Message Syntax RFC specifies the following MIME types and file name extensions for CMS/PKCS#7 messages with these content types.
|Content type|MIME type|Extension| |------------------|---------------|---------------| |envelopedData|application/pkcs7-mime|.p7m| |signedData|application/pkcs7-signature|.p7s.p7c|

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The class has the following default property values: |Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| ||Content Type: 1.2.840.113549.1.7.1 (data)
Length: zero| ||1.2.840.113549.3.7 (RSA_DES_EDE3_CBC) or 2.16.840.1.101.3.4.1.42 (AES-256-CBC)| The default for recipients is . On .NET Framework, the default symmetric encryption algorithm is determined by the version of the .NET Framework that the application executable was built against. Starting with .NET Framework 4.8, the default algorithm is AES-256 in CBC mode; in prior versions, the default is TripleDES (DES3-EDE) in CBC mode. On .NET Core, the default symmetric encryption algorithm is determined by the version of the System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs assembly that is loaded. Starting with the 4.6.0 version of the System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs NuGet package, the default algorithm is AES-256 in CBC mode; in prior versions, the default is TripleDES (DES3-EDE) in CBC mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo contentInfo) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with specified content information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The default <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType> for recipients is <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.IssuerAndSerialNumber>.
On .NET Framework, the default symmetric encryption algorithm is determined by the version of the .NET Framework that the application executable was built against. Starting with .NET Framework 4.8, the default algorithm is AES-256 in CBC mode; in prior versions, the default is TripleDES (DES3-EDE) in CBC mode.
On .NET Core, the default symmetric encryption algorithm is determined by the version of the System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs assembly that is loaded. Starting with the 4.6.0 version of the System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs NuGet package, the default algorithm is AES-256 in CBC mode; in prior versions, the default is TripleDES (DES3-EDE) in CBC mode.

Docs.exception: The parameter is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The default <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType> for recipients is <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierType.IssuerAndSerialNumber>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks On .NET Framework, the default symmetric encryption algorithm is determined by the version of the .NET Framework that the application executable was built against. Starting with .NET Framework 4.8, the default algorithm is AES-256 in CBC mode; in prior versions, the default is TripleDES (DES3-EDE) in CBC mode.
On .NET Core, the default symmetric encryption algorithm is determined by the version of the System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs assembly that is loaded. Starting with the 4.6.0 version of the System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs NuGet package, the default algorithm is AES-256 in CBC mode; in prior versions, the default is TripleDES (DES3-EDE) in CBC mode.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Certificates As X509Certificate2Collection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of certificates associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.
Docs.value: The collection of certificates associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms> class is being used to to encrypt data, the contents of this collection are embedded into the pending message during the call to one of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%2A> methods. Changes after the encryption operation have no effect.
The value of this property is replaced with a different collection object during a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A>, which then represents the certificates that were read out of the decoded message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ContentEncryptionAlgorithm As AlgorithmIdentifier

Docs.summary: Gets the identifier of the symmetric encryption algorithm associated with this message.
Docs.value: The identifier of the symmetric encryption algorithm associated with this message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms> class is being used to to encrypt data, the value of this property indicates which symmetric encryption algorithm to use to encrypt the content of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.ContentInfo>.
The value of this property is replaced during a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A>, which then represents the symmetric encryption algorithm which was used to encrypt the decoded message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ContentInfo As ContentInfo

Docs.summary: Gets the content information for the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.
Docs.value: The content information for the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms> class is being used to to encrypt data, the value of this property represents the data to encrypt. It is not replaced with encrypted content after a call to an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%2A> method.
The value of this property is replaced during a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A>, which then represents the encrypted content decoded from the message. After a successful call to a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt%2A> method, the value is replaced again, with the decrypted message contents.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Decode(unsigned int8[] encodedMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: The byte array containing the sequence of bytes to decode.
Docs.summary: Decodes an array of bytes as a CMS/PKCS#7 EnvelopedData message.
Docs.exception: The parameter is .
The parameter was not successfully decoded.

Docs.summary: Decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Decrypt() cil managed

Docs.summary: Decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message via any available recipient by searching certificate stores for a matching certificate and key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> should be called before <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt?displayProperty=nameWithType> or any other <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decrypt> method does not search the computer My store if it is inaccessible.
## .NET Framework Security The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:
- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Open?displayProperty=nameWithType>
- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Decrypt?displayProperty=nameWithType>

Docs.exception: A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Docs.param: The recipient info to use for decryption.
Docs.summary: Decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message via a specified recipient info by searching certificate stores for a matching certificate and key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks

- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Open?displayProperty=nameWithType>
- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Decrypt?displayProperty=nameWithType>

Docs.param: A collection of certificates to use in addition to the certificate stores for finding a recipient certificate and private key.
Docs.summary: Decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message via any available recipient info by searching certificate stores and a provided collection for a matching certificate and key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## .NET Framework Security The following permissions are required to access the decryption key:
- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Open?displayProperty=nameWithType>
- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Decrypt?displayProperty=nameWithType>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Decrypt(class System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo recipientInfo, class System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm privateKey) cil managed

Docs.param: The recipient info to use for decryption.
The private key to use to decrypt the recipient-specific information.
Docs.summary: Decrypts the contents of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message via a specified recipient info with a specified private key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the other overloads of `Decrypt`, this overload does not search certificate stores. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier.MatchesCertificate(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)> method can be used to manually match an expected certificate to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo.RecipientIdentifier?displayProperty=nameWithType> value to evaluate the applicability of the private key to the recipient info value.

Docs.exception: The or parameter is .
A cryptographic operation could not be completed.
A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] Encode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Encodes the contents of the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message and returns it as a byte array.
Docs.returns: A byte array representing the encoded form of the CMS/PKCS#7 message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can only be called after a successful call to an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%2A> method.

Docs.exception: A method call was invalid for the object's current state.

Docs.summary: Encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS#7 message.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Encrypt() cil managed

Docs.summary: Encrypts the contents of the CMS/PKCS#7 message after selecting recipient certificates via a UI popup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method displays a user interface in which you choose the recipients for whom to encrypt the message. This requires that the current process is running in *user interactive mode*, meaning that the <xref:System.Environment.UserInteractive%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is `true`. A process is normally in user interactive mode unless it is a service process or running inside a Web application.
The user interface will only present certificates that are within their validity period and that have Key Encipherment or Key Agreement included in their key usage.
## .NET Framework Security The following permissions are required to display the user interface:
- <xref:System.Security.Permissions.UIPermissionWindow.SafeTopLevelWindows?displayProperty=nameWithType>

Docs.exception: A cryptographic operation could not be completed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RecipientInfos As RecipientInfoCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection that represents the recipients list for a decoded message. The default value is an empty collection.
Docs.value: A collection that represents the recipients list for a decoded message. The default value is an empty collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although this property is read-only, a modification to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo> objects in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfoCollection> can be done by using their properties.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A> property is not populated as a result of calling the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method nor any of the overloaded EnvelopedCms.Encrypt methods.
The value of this property is replaced with a different collection object during a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A>, which then represents the certificates that were read out of the decoded message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UnprotectedAttributes As CryptographicAttributeObjectCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of unprotected (unencrypted) attributes associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.
Docs.value: The collection of unprotected (unencrypted) attributes associated with the enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms> class is being used to to encrypt data, the contents of this collection are embedded into the pending message during the call to one of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Encrypt%2A> methods. Changes after the encryption operation have no effect.
The value of this property is replaced with a different collection object during a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A>, which then represents the attributes which were attached to the message without being encrypted.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Version As Integer
public: property int Version { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.
Docs.value: The version of the decoded enveloped CMS/PKCS#7 message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property is replaced during a call to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.Decode%2A>, which then represents the version number contained within the message.
